body: Hi @asksteph , I think you cant use `np` inside `predict` as `fh`. Rather use a `list` or `ForecastingHorizon`. Otherwise pls provide error.

I tried several fh conventions from the example in https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/examples/01_forecasting.ipynb. Neither the numpy, list, nor ForecastingHorizon work. I don't think it's an issue with the forecast horizon. 

```
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd

# 2 years of weekly data
train = pd.Series(np.random.uniform(low=2000, high=7000, size=(104,)), index=pd.date_range("2019-01-02", freq="W-WED", periods=104))

# forecast horizon
from sktime.forecasting.base import ForecastingHorizon
fh = ForecastingHorizon(pd.date_range("2021-01-06", periods=26, freq="W-WED"), is_relative=False)

# setup AutoETS model
from sktime.forecasting.ets import AutoETS
forecaster = AutoETS(auto=True, sp=52, n_jobs=-1, restrict=True)
forecaster.fit(train)
pred = forecaster.predict(fh) # <---- this step throws the error
```

Here's the error message:
```
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ValueError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
~\AppData\Local\Temp/ipykernel_7048/1928607663.py in <module>
      3 forecaster = AutoETS(auto=True, sp=52, n_jobs=-1, restrict=True)
      4 forecaster.fit(train)
----> 5 pred = forecaster.predict(fh)

~\anaconda3\envs\py37\lib\site-packages\sktime\forecasting\base\_base.py in predict(self, fh, X, return_pred_int, alpha)
    156         # alpha = check_alpha(alpha)
    157 
--> 158         return self._predict(self.fh, X, return_pred_int=return_pred_int, alpha=alpha)
    159 
    160     def fit_predict(

~\anaconda3\envs\py37\lib\site-packages\sktime\forecasting\base\adapters\_statsmodels.py in _predict(self, fh, X, return_pred_int, alpha)
     78         # statsmodels requires zero-based indexing starting at the
     79         # beginning of the training series when passing integers
---> 80         start, end = fh.to_absolute_int(self._y.index[0], self.cutoff)[[0, -1]]
     81         y_pred = self._fitted_forecaster.predict(start, end)
     82 

~\anaconda3\envs\py37\lib\site-packages\sktime\forecasting\base\_fh.py in to_absolute_int(self, start, cutoff)
    322 
    323         if isinstance(absolute, (pd.PeriodIndex, pd.DatetimeIndex)):
--> 324             integers = _coerce_duration_to_int(integers, freq=_get_freq(cutoff))
    325 
    326         return self._new(integers, is_relative=False)

~\anaconda3\envs\py37\lib\site-packages\sktime\utils\datetime.py in _coerce_duration_to_int(duration, freq)
     43         m = re.match(r"(?P<count>\d*)(?P<unit>[a-zA-Z]+)$", freq)
     44         if not m:
---> 45             raise ValueError("pandas frequency %s not understood." % freq)
     46         count, unit = m.groups()
     47         count = 1 if not count else int(count)

ValueError: pandas frequency W-WED not understood.
```
Let me know what you think. Thank you!
as a hotfix, I did `train.to_period()` which worked well. Generally `sktime` works best with `pd.PeriodIndex`.

I believe this is related to issue #866 and the proposed fix in #867.

I think the fix should still work, but the PR was abandoned by its author before it was ready to merge.
Perhaps someone could take this on?

FYI @xiaobenbenecho in case you are still watching sktime.

Yes. Still watching. Just created another merge request #1409.

This is not a big thing, but it would block the PR from getting merged. If you would like to be shown how to set this up (you see it once then you know how to do it), feel free to join our regular collaboration sessions, next ones are Fridays 1pm UTC on discord.

ah, still failing - make sure you have all the sktime linters installed locally, see developer instructions.

For getting on discord, search for this button on the `sktime` landing page
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7985502/132985143-44f473b7-e6bc-40b9-a956-f9087427358b.png)
the collaboration sessions are usually in the meet-up channel

This is now fixed via https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1409, thanks @xiaobenbenecho!

FYI @asksteph
How do I upgrade sktime to the latest version with this fix? Thanks for all your help.

@asksteph, there are two options:

* wait until the next stable release, which is version 0.8.1 or 0.9.0. The fix will be included with that release.
This happens usually in few weeks to month cycles, so sometime mid of Oct to mid Nov probably.
* install the development version, see instructions here:
https://www.sktime.org/en/stable/installation.html
this will include the fix (and all latest changes), but there is a small risk that it has instabilities which a release version wouldn´t have.
